summary: This document outlines the advice of rights given to an individual before questioning by the FBI. It includes the rights to remain silent, to have legal counsel, and the conditions under which the individual can waive these rights. The document is signed by a witness, indicating the individual's understanding and willingness to proceed without a lawyer.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Paul Byrne is mentioned as a witness in the context of the rights being read to an individual before questioning.

events.title: Advice of Rights
events.description: The rights of an individual were read to them before questioning by the FBI.

keyFacts: The document provides a standard statement of rights that must be read to individuals before questioning.
The individual acknowledged their rights and agreed to answer questions without a lawyer present.
Paul Byrne is noted as a witness to the reading of rights.
